intro: Trichoscypha reygaertii, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits containing seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
